attributes.action: Prosecute MPs who have defrauded the taxpayer
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: MPs who have claimed money fraudulently from the tax payer should be prosecuted, just as any member of the public who had obtained money through deception would be. It is beyond credibility that so many claims were 'made in error', and 'being too busy to check' is not a defence.

rejection.details: Government cannot prosecute individuals or organisations. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes, and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether there is a case to answer, and to prosecute.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
